message_1:
In a Rail fence cipher with 4 rails, the plaintext "HELLOWORLD" is encrypted as follows:

```
H . . . O . . . R . . .
. E . L . W . O . L . D
. . L . . . O . . . H .
. . . O . . . L . . . .
```

What is the ciphertext generated by encrypting the plaintext "GOODMORNING" using the same Rail fence cipher with 4 rails?
message_2:
To encrypt the plaintext "GOODMORNING" using the same Rail fence cipher with 4 rails, we arrange the letters as follows:

```
G . . . M . . . G . . .
. O . O . R . I . N . .
. . O . . . O . . . I .
. . . D . . . N . . . .
```

The ciphertext is generated by reading the letters along the rails from top to bottom, left to right. So, the ciphertext for "GOODMORNING" is "GMOGROIONODN".
